articles.headline: Clean Living in the Henhouse
articles.snippet: At an Indiana farm, precautions are taken to keep hens and eggs free of salmonella.
articles.abstract: At an Indiana farm, precautions are taken to keep hens and eggs free of salmonella.
articles.lead_paragraph: NORTH MANCHESTER, Ind.  The stuff doesn’t even smell that bad.

articles.headline: TV’s Future Has Arrived (Almost)
articles.snippet: Two new set-top boxes from Roku and Apple, though flawed, offer ways to supply on-demand TV shows, provide Internet access and obtain movies.
articles.abstract: Two new set-top boxes from Roku and Apple, though flawed, offer ways to supply on-demand TV shows, provide Internet access and obtain movies.
articles.lead_paragraph: Americans used to gather in front of their TV sets on, say, Thursday at 8 p.m. and tune in to Channel 3. The upside: the whole country had a common cultural bond.

articles.headline: F.T.C. Accuses Tax Relief Company of Empty Promises
articles.snippet: The agency said that American Tax Relief, which claimed it could help taxpayers settle tax bills for pennies on the dollar, did no such thing.
articles.abstract: The agency said that American Tax Relief, which claimed it could help taxpayers settle tax bills for pennies on the dollar, did no such thing.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Who wouldn’t like to settle with the Internal Revenue Service for pennies on the dollar?

articles.headline: Rampant Fraud Threat to China’s Brisk Ascent
articles.snippet: The faking of academic credentials is pervasive enough that many worry it may slow China’s development.
articles.abstract: The faking of academic credentials is pervasive enough that many worry it may slow China’s development.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — No one disputes Zhang Wuben’s talents as a salesman. Through television shows, DVDs and a best-selling book, he convinced millions of people that raw eggplant and immense quantities of mung beans could cure lupus, diabetes, depression and cancer.

articles.headline: MSNBC.com May Change Its Name
articles.snippet: The Web site, which stresses objectivity in its news coverage, does not want to share its name with MSNBC, the cable channel of the same name, which has a liberal slant.
articles.abstract: The Web site, which stresses objectivity in its news coverage, does not want to share its name with MSNBC, the cable channel of the same name, which has a liberal slant.
articles.lead_paragraph: NBC Universal and Microsoft, the parents of msnbc.com, are holding high-level talks about changing its name, an unusual and potentially risky endeavor for the third most popular news Web site in the United States.

articles.headline: Waivers Aim at Talk of Dropping Health Coverage
articles.snippet: The administration wants to defuse resistance to the new law by granting waivers to maintain minimal coverage.
articles.abstract: The administration wants to defuse resistance to the new law by granting waivers to maintain minimal coverage.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Obama administration officials put into place the first major wave of changes under the health care legislation, they have tried to defuse stiffening resistance  from companies like McDonald’s and some insurers  by granting dozens of waivers to maintain even minimal coverage far below the new law’s standards.

articles.headline: U.S. Tries to Calm Pakistan Over Airstrike
articles.snippet: As the White House tried to mollify Pakistan over an airstrike, officials said there were larger tensions.
articles.abstract: As the White House tried to mollify Pakistan over an airstrike, officials said there were larger tensions.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration scrambled to halt a sharp deterioration in its troubled relationship with Pakistan on Wednesday, offering Pakistani officials multiple apologies for a helicopter strike on a border post that killed three Pakistani soldiers last week.
articles.byline: By Helene Cooper and Eric Schmitt
